summary: coronaviruses belong to the order Nidovirales and family Coronaviridae. they are classified into four genera namely Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, Gammacoronavirus, and Deltacoronavirus. the previously unknown betacoronaviruses have emerged as human pathogens within the last twenty years. bats have been identified as the source of most human coronaviruses. some are believed to have used livestock intermediate hosts for transmission to humans similar to MERS-CoV which made use of dromedary camels. human coronavirus NL63 does not have any known intermediate host but viruses closely related to this have also been found in bats. clade 2c coronaviruses could be a significant step for the eventual spillover into the human population. exposure of livestock species to this bat virus could be a significant step for the eventual spillover into the human population. n = 592 AC 100 (2.4) 20 (3.4) AF 77 (1.8) 2 (0.3) AGD 618 (14.5) 61 (10.3) AGV 132 (3.1) 30 (5.1) AGB 52 (1.2) -
